website_summaries.verdict: A good budget adjuster and self massager that provides instant pain relief.
pros: Move the adjuster over sore areas or roll over it on the floor
Makes it easier to reach the back and legs
Can conveniently carry it around with you if necessary
cons: Performs better on certain areas of the body than others

customer_reviews.title: Caused bruising - STAY AWAY
customer_reviews.text: These are HARD plastic items. So hard that they caused bruising and short term nerve damage until I could get to a doctor who fixed me. I was out of work. It gave me a headache which is something I've never before. These should never be sold on Amazon as they are a health hazard. I did not give them away I threw them away so no one else got hurt. I would like my money back but by the time I went to the doctor and was feeling better Amazon said my window closed July 6th. Its now July 19th. Yes, it took me over a month to get better and get back to my job.
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Love these!! Great for headaches
customer_reviews.text: I suffer from headaches and migraines caused by a concussion to the back of the head. These tools really help my occupital and neck area. I get extremely tight muscles and achy feeling due to occipital neuralgia so these blocks really help me. It allows me to get some blood flow into that area so it doesn’t feel as tight and pinched. It definitely makes a difference in my headaches and how I feel over all.
customer_reviews.author: charlotte

customer_reviews.title: Not only works but works fast
customer_reviews.text: My Physical Therapist recommended this to me and I am so glad he did. It is the best way for me to relieve trigger point pressure by myself. I use it every morning on my neck to relieve pain and pressure. I just have to lay on it and relax- it works so much better than tennis or lacrosse balls and it extremely affordable.
customer_reviews.author: C. Mitchel

customer_reviews.title: Get The Combo Pack, You Might Need To Use 2 At Once...
customer_reviews.text: These things are GREAT! With gentle pressure, these have cracked spots in my back even my chiropractor couldn't get to move. Combined with the Body Back Buddy, I'm finding new relief I haven't been able to find in over a decade. There's work to do for me but for the first time in a long time, I have real improvement.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Boufford

customer_reviews.title: "Soft" tool is not at all soft.
customer_reviews.text: Great idea and I thought it would help with my shoulder pain and headaches. However, these are very cheap hard plastic (even the soft one is hard) and they are not weighted on the bottom so they move around when you try to lay on them. They do not allow for any adjustment in size. I will be looking for something higher in quality. These are going back.
customer_reviews.author: T.L.

customer_reviews.title: Great acupressure tool for head and neck ache
customer_reviews.text: The acupressure for cervical vertebral muscles causing neck pain is fabulous. I like that you can do one side or bilaterally. It works in my recliner or bed. I also like that us is small enough to perform trigger point release that full neck support devices can not. Releasing sub occipitals and the headache trigeminal nerve can be done with this devise. Wish they also made a model with softer tips and a shorter one for the back. As a myoskeletal therapist I would buy both. Anyone who has deep neck work knows that is an extremely sensitive area. Considering the price, well worth it
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Total lifesaver for me!
customer_reviews.text: I have looked for a tool like this for a long time. As a massage therapist, I have plenty of neck and shoulder work to do on myself, but my fingers and hands aren’t up for the job, especially at the end of a long day of doing massage. With this tool, I can get into the muscles all around the base of my skull with very little effort. I personally prefer the “hard” version, as the soft one tends to bend under the kind of pressure I like.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: it's not difficult to figure these out. i used this while sitting on the couch with a soft pillow behind my head & neck. i was able to get into all the really tense areas in the back of my neck and get them to relax & let go.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not useful for suboccipital release
customer_reviews.text: Both colors are the same "firmness" as far as I can tell. These don't work for suboccipital release because they tip over when you get them in the right position at the base of your skull. Kinda pricey for pleasure and not very usable
customer_reviews.author: Brendan

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping that these would have a different softness between the two items but the are both the same hard plastic. I was Not expecting a miracle by any means but I feel these are overpriced for what you actually receive. If I could return them I would but my return time has expired. I would recommend that the reader of this receive invest in a golf ball or baseball and place those umber your trouble spots instead of spending $30+ for two pieces of plastic.
customer_reviews.author: msmith

customer_reviews.title: A-MAZING!
customer_reviews.text: AMAZING! I'm a frequent and long-time migraine sufferer. It's so hard to function with migraines, but life goes on, but in a massive amount of pain. The DaVinci Tool is incredible and gets right where I need it most. It takes about 20-30 minutes of resting, rubbing, and maneuvering about the different sides, but it has given me relief and gotten rid of on-coming migraines. I'm so grateful for this product. It's the real deal!!!
customer_reviews.author: tiffanie arthur

customer_reviews.title: Great for releaving knots in back!!
customer_reviews.text: I have a desk job and sometimes sit for up to 12 hrs a day!! This can reek HAVIC on your low back, glutes, and sacrum!! I am in pain constantly!! This little tool can be layed on and relieves the pressure in any area!! Traps, hips, full spine, calves, neck-ANYWHERE!! I recommend for everyone w/ tightness in their bodies. Its not a cure all but it gets you through the day!! I prefer the side w/ the rounded edges, lays perfectly on either side of the spine for a good cracking and applies pressure to the occipital muscles at the base of the skull for headaches or neck cramps. A GREAT INVESTMENT!! I carry it in my bag everyday!!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda E. Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed!
customer_reviews.text: The pictures are misleading. Very difficult to position in a way that effectively releases trigger points without the unit getting away from you. Perhaps if they were larger they would be easier to position. Also, NOT too much difference between the red and blue. Overall, NOT a good value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Rodney R.

customer_reviews.title: it is *so* painful! it's also very hard to position by yourself
customer_reviews.text: ive only tried the red "soft" one, it is *so* painful! it's also very hard to position by yourself. sending this back.
customer_reviews.author: phgirl72

customer_reviews.title: A bit awkward to use
customer_reviews.text: Still trying to figure out exactly how to use these. They're very uncomfortable but do provide pressure in the spots I need if I can get into the right position
customer_reviews.author: William Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Great tools to have to release neck, shoulder and back pain
customer_reviews.text: Great to have to release neck, shoulder and back pain. Easy to use and have instant results. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: softer one is useless but hard one is really good
customer_reviews.text: i like the hard one but the softer one is totally useless. i'd ust order the hard one if i had to do it again. i use the hard one all the time, feels great on your neck and lower back
customer_reviews.author: Timmay

customer_reviews.title: Great find!
customer_reviews.text: An excellent tool for neck pain at the base of my skull. I haven't yet figured out how to use it on my shoulders, but the friend who let me borrow hers before I ordered this is teaching me. I gave her the blue one because it's very hard. The red one has a little flexibility but is firm enough to give pain relief.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: this is close to perfect. I can't imagine using anything but the rounded ...
customer_reviews.text: For certain knots, especially the ones along/under my shoulder blad, this is close to perfect. I can't imagine using anything but the rounded edge and I wish they made one that there was no notch taken out of the middle, but this still works better than anything I've tried besides a real massage.
customer_reviews.author: David Almquist

customer_reviews.title: Quick Symptom Relief
customer_reviews.text: When my neck is tight a couple of minutes on this wedge will relax the muscles, reduce pain, and head ache
customer_reviews.author: LH

customer_reviews.title: Deep tissue pressure!
customer_reviews.text: It's perfect to apply pressure to that knot that just never releases.... the blue one is extremely hard with no give, the red has a bit of spring, but still others would consider to be hard... The design is perfect to get to the hard to reach trigger point on your back between your shoulders. Love them!
customer_reviews.author: JulieL

customer_reviews.title: Device rolls over (unstable) when attempting to apply pressure. ...
customer_reviews.text: Device rolls over (unstable) when attempting to apply pressure. Too severe for neck, I prefer to use a Denneroll for cervical therapy.
customer_reviews.author: PT

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE this product
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this product. I get migraines frequently, and I find relief in pressure on the muscles at the base of my skull and neck. I use these at least 2-3 times a week to help ease or ward off the pain, and it's small enough to fit in my luggage when I travel (which I do frequently). I leave one at home and one in my luggage. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: sieepyhead

customer_reviews.title: Pressure off
customer_reviews.text: I have neck surgery and suffer from a lot of headaches pressuring my occipital muscles and nerve. Up to now nothing has curved some of the pressure off. This is an awesome tool. Highly recommend. Have only used it on my occipital muscles 3xs and on gluteus 1. What a relieve.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline L.

customer_reviews.title: This product is worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: This product really works. I had headaches and eye pain due to a neck injury. This product relieved the pain I was experiencing in lesscthan minutes of using it. I slept better than I have in months.
customer_reviews.author: Ralphie

customer_reviews.title: Was ok Body Back Buddy is Better
customer_reviews.text: Was ok Body Back Buddy is Better...this is too stagnant and there is just something about it that doesn't quiet release the tension for me.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Woodard

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Just a good idea for a product that does t waste your money or your time
customer_reviews.author: matthew crocker

customer_reviews.title: Can't lose!
customer_reviews.text: The product is well built, materials & design, good quality, works well comes instruction tips, and 1 is soft one is hard, depending on your treatment desires. I would recommend
customer_reviews.author: jeff

customer_reviews.title: Very good product
customer_reviews.text: Takes some getting used to, but worked well for my sore trap tendons. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: John Mark Harris

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: My physical therapist suggested I get some of these because I suffer from chronic migraines and lots of tight and sore muscles. The different sides make it perfect for any situation. It's perfect for getting under your shoulder blade or the back of your head and neck. I use the red one most often. It does take some getting used to on trying different positions and things to see what helps you most.
customer_reviews.author: TI

customer_reviews.title: Interesting tool to have
customer_reviews.text: Interesting tool to have. Gaps are a bit to narrow but with practice you can get it comfortable enough. Also firm=solid hard soft=hard
customer_reviews.author: Nate n Amy

customer_reviews.title: small and hard
customer_reviews.text: Got these for a friend; was surprised that even the "soft" wedge was really hard - seemed quite uncomfortable to me.
customer_reviews.author: J Wutzke

customer_reviews.title: What did generative spine disease, this does relieve some pain
customer_reviews.text: What did generative spine disease, this does relieve some pain
customer_reviews.author: JFK

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for deep neck pain, base of skull knots, take your time to feel out all the angles and positions and it’s perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Even for hard to reach trigger points items like the corner of my coffee table, or a baseball work better than these tools, they are somewhat helpful, but they are not designed well enough for long time sufferers that need to get in deep. They are somewhat helpful, and my kid has used them more than me, but for me they sit under my bed, I need tools that are more stable and reach deeper. I have had great success after 10 years of suffering.
customer_reviews.author: GlanzTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Like these!
customer_reviews.text: I like these but it is a little hard to balance them on the bottom surface. I use the five indented part the most. I gave one to a friend and she uses it for her shoulder blade. She said it is great.
customer_reviews.author: Christa A Elliott

customer_reviews.title: Truly works.
customer_reviews.text: Finally something that works. They look and feel great and they really work. LOVE them.
customer_reviews.author: Argman

customer_reviews.title: Love, love
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love these. My car was t-boned a few years back and add a result my neck and upper back are a mess. These are so helpful especially after doing anything physical. I highly recommend these
customer_reviews.author: CM

customer_reviews.title: Crazy enough they do feel great. Our family regularly seeks these out to get ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought these on the recommendation of our massage therapist. Crazy enough they do feel great. Our family regularly seeks these out to get a muscle knot out or relieve a headache.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just hit the purchase now button
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why I waited so long to buy these. Laying on them feels amazing! I get them to go in even deeper by putting a feather pillow underneath and angling it where I want it to put more pressure. SERIOUSLY AMAZING!
customer_reviews.author: Chrstof

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly good.
customer_reviews.text: This tool is surprisingly good. I'm finally able to work out some tight inner thigh points. I found I could use it on my upper inner thigh (adductors). My elbow/forearm rests nicely in the cradle while I can really apply a lot of pressure on my tight adductors and upper quads.
customer_reviews.author: Dana L Hirsch

customer_reviews.title: I went on an extended backpacking trip last summer and ...
customer_reviews.text: I went on an extended backpacking trip last summer and had been having chronic hip issues since then. I've been using this tool to release tension in my hamstrings, lower back, upper back, and neck. It's made a world of difference! I wish I hadn't waited so long to find this tool!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Eisel

customer_reviews.title: They bend and collapse - didn't work.
customer_reviews.text: Both of these collapse when you lay on the floor with either under your back. I'm normal weight, height, etc.
customer_reviews.author: LJohnson

customer_reviews.title: Helps Neck Pain
customer_reviews.text: Nice tool. although, I don't really see much difference between the firm and the soft. But I will still rate them pretty good. For I have been in physical therapy for a couple of months with neck pain. And this tool mimics the pressure the therapists apply to sore or achy spots. I am please with the results that I obtain from this product. I keep one at work and one at home. In my case it seems to help me a lot.
customer_reviews.author: David Garris

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool
customer_reviews.text: The DaVinci device is a great tool to use for those pesky back and leg ailments. A few minutes make a big difference in my day.
customer_reviews.author: Rodney W. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Neck relief
customer_reviews.text: Works great on my neck. Was skeptical but glad I got these
customer_reviews.author: Kim Allen

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work so great for suboccipital release
customer_reviews.text: Perhaps there's a learning curve. Doesn't work so great for suboccipital release, but I've found it helpful for stretching my rhomboids.
customer_reviews.author: Crafty Lady

customer_reviews.title: Didn't Keep-Returned
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what how this would help? I didn't find them helpful at all
customer_reviews.author: THM

customer_reviews.title: Recommend!
customer_reviews.text: It takes a bit to adjust to using these, but they have helped release knots and tension in my back and neck.
customer_reviews.author: mzstre

customer_reviews.title: For those hard to pop joints and difficult to massage places
customer_reviews.text: These are so good at being "little helpers" for trying to pop a stubborn vertabrae or a sore back that they have made it all around my office as people borrow them. Necks, shoulders, backs, feet have all been treated with these babies. Definately a must have for the hunched over office worker
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: Great for your body
customer_reviews.text: These tools work great on any part of your body with knots, tightness, and stiffness. They even help me adjust my neck and back when it's tweaked by loosening up soft tissue, and then using body weight to add pressure for adjustments. Great tool for someone with problematic areas. I find the hard (blue) one is a little too painful and don't use it as often as the soft (red) one.
customer_reviews.author: janettis

customer_reviews.title: Still learning exactly how to use these, where to ...
customer_reviews.text: Still learning exactly how to use these, where to place them, etc. I prefer the red one that is harder - helps relieve the opcipital pain in my neck.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly Cummings

customer_reviews.title: effective
customer_reviews.text: I recommend getting the set of two (one soft & one firm) DaVinci Tools. Having both gives you the option to use soft or firm in different trouble areas. I've used both, and find them to be very effective in releasing muscles as well as trigger points. They're perfect for self care. The only downside would be trying to place them in the perfect spot if it's behind you (hard to reach).
customer_reviews.author: S. King reader

customer_reviews.title: Recommended for tension and stiffness
customer_reviews.text: Good device, 2-3 minutes 2-3 times a weeks loosens the muscles and tension.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick J

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied, but...
customer_reviews.text: These products satisfactorily perform their task. I would have appreciated a brochure that went into a bit more detail on how to get the most out of the product, especially how many minutes it should be used in a session to achieve the best results. Only a small card with a few pictures is provided. And at times I feel a bit like Goldilocks... the firm one (blue) is too hard, and the soft one (red) is too soft. I need one that's just right!
customer_reviews.author: John W. Coleman

customer_reviews.title: useful back tools
customer_reviews.text: Well-made pieces of useful back tools. And addition to my back therapy I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Judy McConnell

customer_reviews.title: WAY WORTH IT!!
customer_reviews.text: A few minutes on these and I'm feeling much better! I was skeptical, but they really do help! I have problems with all 3 sections of my spine so I was desperate enough to go out on a limb and I'm certainly glad that I did!
customer_reviews.author: TheSassyCEO

customer_reviews.title: I don't get it.
customer_reviews.text: I read the instructions, watched videos and I just can't seem to get these things in a position where I feel any relief whatsoever. Other users seem to rave about them but after extensive use, I'm just sending them back.
customer_reviews.author: Trombone123

customer_reviews.title: Versatile shiatsu/traction device - it’s a keeper
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased a number of shiatsu and traction devices. I have also returned some. This one is a keeper for its design, versatility, & effectiveness. You can use it many different ways & for different trouble spots. To me, it’s unique for its ability to provide both pressure & traction. I purchased the combo pack, which includes both the red (softer) and blue (harder) device. So far, the red device, which is not all that soft, is the only one I’ve used, but I can foresee using the blue one. It’s great that while versatile, these devices r light & compact. Mine is accompanying me on my next plane flight.
customer_reviews.author: emg

customer_reviews.title: Too Hard - Had to Return
customer_reviews.text: Just too hard to lay against. Softer material should have been used for manufacturing these, considering their intended use. Did not find them to be therapeutic at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just get the soft one.
customer_reviews.text: This review is for both the firm and soft DaVinci tools. There's no need to get the firm one, it's just a piece of hard plastic. The soft one does feel like it does some work on the sore muscle, and you're able to apply different amounts of pressure. I recommend just getting the soft tool by itself, and save a little money.
customer_reviews.author: DelScorcho

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the pair of them and found that the soft tool works best for me in most cases. I typically use it for my neck and trigger points in the shoulder blade; you don't have to use them long...about 2/5 minutes. They travel well, and I would rececommend them highly for anyone wanting to get into those areas that get tight and need loosening up before you see your massage therapist and/or chiropractor. Experience in ordering through Amazaon was great! Received them quickly!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie McWillaims

customer_reviews.title: DaVinci Tool
customer_reviews.text: I prefer the blue which is very firm, the red is ok too, but kind of soft for me.
customer_reviews.author: amazoner

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great Tool!!! I'm a massage therapist and I love this item!!!
customer_reviews.author: Shad Welch

customer_reviews.title: Great for back therapy !
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived well packaged, on time and as described in the item description. Great quality and can easily recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: LightsF15

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: They do exactly what they look like they do. Overall pleased with the purchase. It can be hard to find something to get that spot on my neck at the right angle and these do a great job of it
customer_reviews.author: Eric Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Fab
customer_reviews.text: Great quality tools in really great colors. My wife uses these regularly and has found them to be very useful.
customer_reviews.author: D. Adams

customer_reviews.title: great.  no surprises
customer_reviews.text: Just sturdy plastic to manipulate your neck and back. it's fine. I always end up going too deep with it, though. I would recommend if you're considering.
customer_reviews.author: RaRah

customer_reviews.title: Gem of a tool for trigger points
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had know about the DaVinci tool before now. This has to be one of the greatest inventions for people w/trigger points in back, buttocks, etc. I was on the fence about buying them, as I have just about every apparatus known to man to try and aid my back. Well, let me tell you, this can be used on the floor, against a wall and the pressure you control. Just like being at a massage therapist having your trigger points worked on. Brought the red one to work tonight and was using it against the wall. Again, I just cant say enough about this product.
customer_reviews.author: L. Biskup

customer_reviews.title: I generally like it, works well on occipital and neck areas ...
customer_reviews.text: I generally like it, works well on occipital and neck areas that are sore and hard to reach with rollers and balls.
customer_reviews.author: Mosaic

customer_reviews.title: They're pretty much what it looks like
customer_reviews.text: I have Ehlers-Danlos Syndrome hypermobile type and use these for my muscle issues. They're pretty much what it looks like. I use them often.
customer_reviews.author: EE

customer_reviews.title: Tool for Serious Forced-Relaxation of Muscle Tissue
customer_reviews.text: I bought the two-pack, due to their different material makeup. The red is soft, and great for scapula area; digging in working out knots. The bluer and more stiffly-defined tool is for resting the cranial-sacral tension (Neji's blind spot), using gravity to force-release the hold. Almost-orgasmic. Either that, or I'm overdue for one of those "come-undid-grammar-be-damned" spiritual experiences.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Gautam Hota

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: The DaVinci tool has given me a lot of relief, especially from shoulder pain and tension. The soft one is very firm, so unless you need two of them I would recommend the softer one. I use the soft one at home and keep the firm one in my desk at work.
customer_reviews.author: T. Risher

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: I expected something more efficient for pain release. Both are too hard, and too high, so they are not comfortable. Instead, I am using a yogurt container to release my back pain, and that is more effective and I can even massage my self with that, without hurting my skin.
customer_reviews.author: Ana

customer_reviews.title: really stretches your neck
customer_reviews.text: I have chronic neck pain but this tool-I prefer the blue, it is harder really gives you a good stretch, I also move it along my spine and it's is almost like getting a massage
customer_reviews.author: Tamara

customer_reviews.title: Good for headaches
customer_reviews.text: The davinci tool is great for getting rid of tension headaches - just place below base of skull at tight muscles and just lay there for a while. Haven't been able to use the firm one yet - too hard. I have used it some family members for other areas and they like it too.
customer_reviews.author: Lisapta

customer_reviews.title: These are tops man!
customer_reviews.text: These are tops man! I bring them everywhere and it's hilarious when friends try to figure out what it's used for
customer_reviews.author: Matt Sievert

customer_reviews.title: Just OK
customer_reviews.text: I got these for myself and multiple family member. I am a runner and am a big fan of self massage. Really the only place I'm able to use it effectively is low back where it fits to hit points on both sides of the spine. However the shape feels awkward most anywhere else and I prefer a lacrosse ball to really dig in.
customer_reviews.author: NUnger

customer_reviews.title: Nice to have around
customer_reviews.text: These are great to work out the kinks in my first 2 cervical vertebrae. My dog chewed one is a puppy but it still works just fine- she almost never chewed anything so it's OK. They're the kind of thing that pop up periodically and I'm happy to see them so I use them for a while. I have chronic pain so things like this are nice to have on hand.
customer_reviews.author: A•Ha

customer_reviews.title: junk
customer_reviews.text: This product was not helpfull for my aching back. I found it uncomfortable and over priced for what you're getting. I need a lot of pressure which this can provide, but didn't find it to do any good. The Theracane is the answer though!! Try that!!
customer_reviews.author: rbslift

customer_reviews.title: Works great if you have a stiff neck and need help ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great if you have a stiff neck and need help poping it back to normal. Even the chiropractor wasn't able to get it to pop out and I was in great pain. I worked it out myself with the DaVinci and I am very happy with the results. When the problems ever start to come back I just use it again to help stretch out the neck.
customer_reviews.author: Cubby

customer_reviews.title: or perhaps they were too tall to put under me comfortably. I am 5'3" for reference and I could ...
customer_reviews.text: This was SO hard and awkward to use. I must not have been using them right, or perhaps they were too tall to put under me comfortably. I am 5'3" for reference and I could not get this under my hip area or shoulder area with out it being incredibly uncomfortable. I usually love a hard, deep massage too, so I thought this would be up my alley
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Meh.
customer_reviews.text: Wife loves these because she can get it right where she needs it on her neck. I HATE THESE. They're both too hard and do not get any of places I need them to. At all. Lying on a tennis ball is far more effective and cheaper than these. Such a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: sharp edges
customer_reviews.text: They are a great concept, but both items have sharp edges, all the way around, at every point, that cut me.
customer_reviews.author: Slayer57

customer_reviews.title: Davinci Soft tool
customer_reviews.text: I read some good reviews for this product-thats why I bought it. My only issue is that it did not come with enough instructions on how to use it. I have severe occipital nerve pain and neck pain. But I guess I will keep trying it. If anyone know a good website on how to use it please let me know. I would really appreciate it. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: I use it under my neck to try to prevent ...
customer_reviews.text: I use it under my neck to try to prevent migraines. I can't say if it helped much. Quite uncomfortable but I will continue to see if the product might gradually work.
customer_reviews.author: enkay

customer_reviews.title: Lote it!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. It's the only tool I've found that can get to very deep, very specific trigger points, with enough pressure to actually release them, not just mute the pain for a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Drumbor

customer_reviews.title: Helpful little tools
customer_reviews.text: These two rubber tools are helpful in releasing tension in tight muscles, the only drawbacks are that they can be difficult to manipulate if you have small hands, and even the "soft" one isn't very giving, making for a hard surface pressing into you on if you are working on yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Stahl

customer_reviews.title: Hmmm
customer_reviews.text: Not living up to what I expected. I can do more and better by using the many different sized balls I have around here. I feel like I wasted my money on these.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

product_meta.title: Davinci Tool Firm & Extra Firm Combo Pack - Neck, Shoulder & Back Pain Relief - Tension Headache & Migraine Reliever, Occipital Release Tool
feature_bullets: Release Neck Tension - Soothe muscles in your neck to relieve headaches, migraines and stress
Goodbye to Pressure Points - Relieve pain and reduce tension nearly anywhere on your body
3 Different Edges - Equipped with a Round, Pointed and Scalloped edge to adjust massage intensity
Portable - At 4 inches on the longest side, the DaVinci Tool fits perfectly in any gym bag or pack
2 Awesome Self-Massage Tools - DaVinci Extra Firm for the tough tension, DaVinci Firm for easy relief
